title: It’s time for Conservatives to put tax reduction and reform centre stage
text:
At last week’s Conservative Party conference there wasn’t enough talk about tax. Indeed, the Conservatives’ emerging agenda of increased public spending, relaxed public borrowing targets and large increases in the minimum wage could easily be taken for the Labour Party’s policy programme – at least the Labour Party of yore.

The political justification is clear enough. Yet tax reform and tax cuts should be an essential part of what a Johnson-led government should be trying to achieve.

Even so, it is important not to go from one extreme to the other, that is to say, to go from resisting all radical plans for reducing taxes to throwing all caution to the winds.
